trainer.title: Blunder Trainer
trainer.empty.no_games_message: Import your games from Lichess or Chess.com to start training on your blunders.
trainer.empty.no_blunders_message: Your games have been imported but no blunders were found yet. Run analysis to identify blunders in your games.
trainer.empty.no_matching_message: No blunders found with the current filters. Try selecting different filters or clear them to see all blunders.
trainer.empty.default_message: Import your games to start training on your blunders.
trainer.instructions.text: Find a better move than your blunder.
trainer.instructions.drag: Drag pieces to make a move, then click Submit to check.
trainer.instructions.show_best: Click "Show Best" to reveal the engine's recommendation.
trainer.move_indicator.label: Your move:
trainer.filters.title: Puzzle Filters
trainer.feedback.same_blunder_detail: You played the same blunder again: {userMove}. The best move was {bestMove}
trainer.feedback.good_move_detail: Your move {userMove} is solid. Best was {bestMove}
trainer.feedback.no_move: Drag a piece to make a move first.
trainer.shortcuts.title: Keyboard Shortcuts
heatmap.days: {count, plural, one {# active day} other {# active days}}
dashboard.title: Blunder Tutor Dashboard
dashboard.chart.puzzle_activity_desc: Your puzzle solving activity over the past year.
dashboard.chart.blunders_by_phase_desc: Understand where in your games you tend to make mistakes.
dashboard.chart.no_phase_data: No blunder data available yet. Analyze some games to see your phase breakdown.
dashboard.chart.blunders_by_color_desc: Compare your blunder rate when playing as white versus black.
dashboard.chart.no_color_data: No blunder data available yet. Analyze some games to see your color breakdown.
dashboard.chart.blunders_by_game_type_de: Compare your blunder rate across different time controls.
dashboard.chart.no_game_type_data: No game type data available yet. Analyze some games to see your blunders by time control.
dashboard.chart.blunders_by_opening_desc: See which openings give you the most trouble.
dashboard.chart.no_opening_data: No opening data available yet. Analyze some games to see your opening breakdown.
dashboard.chart.blunders_by_tactical_des: Understand what types of tactical mistakes you make most often.
dashboard.chart.no_tactical_data: No tactical pattern data available yet. Run a backfill to analyze existing blunders for tactical patterns.
dashboard.chart.accuracy_by_date_desc: Track your game accuracy over time. Higher = better play (0–100 scale).
dashboard.chart.no_accuracy_data: No game data available yet. Import and analyze some games to see your accuracy trends.
dashboard.chart.accuracy_by_hour: Game Accuracy by Hour of Day
dashboard.chart.accuracy_by_hour_desc: Discover when you play your most accurate chess.
dashboard.chart.no_hourly_data: No game data available yet. Import and analyze some games to see your hourly accuracy patterns.

management.jobs.title: Recent Jobs
management.jobs.delete_confirm: Are you sure you want to delete this job?
management.danger.title: Danger Zone
management.danger.description: Delete all imported games, analysis results, puzzle attempts, and job history.
management.danger.confirm1:
Are you sure you want to delete ALL data?

This will permanently remove:
• All imported games
• All analysis results
• All puzzle attempts
• All job history

This action cannot be undone!
management.danger.confirm2:
This is your final warning!

Click OK to permanently delete all data.

dashboard.chart.blunders_by_difficulty_d: See how many of your blunders were easy to avoid versus genuinely tricky positions.
dashboard.chart.no_difficulty_data: No difficulty data available yet. Re-analyze games to compute difficulty scores.
dashboard.difficulty.help_intro: Each blunder is scored 0–100 based on how hard the best move was to find. This helps separate careless mistakes from genuinely tricky positions.
dashboard.difficulty.help_easy: The best move was a capture or check, or there were many safe alternatives. You should have seen it.
dashboard.difficulty.help_medium: The best move required some calculation. A mix of tactical and positional considerations.
dashboard.difficulty.help_hard: The best move was a quiet, non-forcing move with few safe alternatives. Even strong players might miss it.
dashboard.difficulty.help_factors: Factors: best move type (capture/check = easier), number of legal non-losing moves, and depth of the required calculation.
